ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: depends fully on your lab. Do not learn much from the class itself but is a good way to make the research you're doing anyways count. Proposals and final papers are good way to make sure you know your research. However, having final paper due on the last day of classes is a bit brutal.
I continued working on the project I began during the summer of 2022. The final report taught me how to write a methods, results, and discussion section of a scientific paper
I learned how to manage research with a full time course load
I was able to spend a lot of time in the lab doing hands-on research. I developed skills in laboratory techniques that I am excited to use for future research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: works very well for what it is
weakness: shorten requirement for final paper. Most people don't have a 15 page paper that can be made out of a few hundred hours of lab work.

There is really no professor interaction in this course. You are doing research in your lab completely on your own time and with your mentor's help. I've talked to some friends who have taken the MB&B version of this class, and they have meetings with the professor/meetings as a class every once in a while throughout the semester. It would be really nice to have a similar thing to this class, just to make sure that I'm on the right track and am able to ask questions if need be. I had a lot of issues with getting in contact with the professors of this class (I emailed multiple times, got no response), so having meetings like this would help with those issues. Finally, please please please please please stop including references in the page count for the two assignments. Writing my final report and my grant proposal was extremely difficult not because of content, but because of page limits, and having to include references in that count just made it unnecessarily annoying. Please remove references from the page count.

A strength would be learning how to do all those basic research skills. A weakness of this class is that it is an independent course: all you have is yourself, the syllabus, and whatever help you have in your lab environment (which will vary greatly person to person)
Very independent if thats what youre looking for. Some syllabus instructions seemed to be off through.

The strength of this course was the incredible one-on-one guidance and mentorship I received from my PI and the post-doc that I was working with. I am very looking forward to continuing to work with them in future semesters.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It's a no brainer if you are already doing research

If you are interested in doing research throughout the year, absolutely. You basically get to work in your lab with no assignments to turn in until the very end. For someone like me, who would go into lab anyway, getting credit for the time is nice.
I would only recommend if you have the time and/or willing to give the sacrifices associated with spending 10+ hours of research as an underclassman.
Yes! Great way to do independent research
Yes absolutely! It's a great way to get hands-on experience doing research.
